article.headline: Richmond 62, Duquesne 48
article.story: PITTSBURGH (AP) -- Jermaine Bucknor and Kevin Steenberge each scored 12 points to help Richmond to a 62-48 win over Duquesne on Wednesday. Richmond (8-7, 1-1 Atlantic 10 Conference) led 30-28 at the half, but exploded for a 14-2 run in the first four minutes of the second half to open up a 44-30 lead and take control of what had been a close game. "We just wanted to be assertive and put our will on the game," Richmond coach Chris Mooney said. Peter Thomas and Gaston Moliva each added 11 for Richmond, while Duquesne was led by senior guard Chris McAllister, who scored 19 and was the only Dukes player in double figures. Duquesne (2-12, 0-3) played its first game without Jack Higgins, who left the team Tuesday for academic reasons. Higgins was averaging 9.3 points per game and led the team in 3-pointers. The Dukes also played without DeVario Hudson, who was diagnosed with a heart murmur. "I've never had (a team) decimated like this," coach Danny Nee said. Neither team could establish momentum in the first half as both struggled from the field and in the half-court game. Each team had a 7-0 run before the half, with Duquesne using its to take an early 7-3 lead with 15:31 to play, while Richmond overcame a three-point deficit to take a 27-23 advantage later.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
